results.title: Hidden agenda
results.creator_credit: Eric Fellner, Hemdale Film Corporation and Ken Loach
results.brief_description: American lawyer Paul Sullivan (Brad Dourif), is working in Northern Ireland as part of a group similar to Amnesty International, when he is assassinated by police who claimed that he failed to stop at a road block and was in the company of a suspected terrorist. His fiancee and fellow activist Ingrid Jessner (Frances McDormand) is left shattered. She has a glimmer of hope that justice will prevail after the arrival of British policeman Paul Kerrigan (Brian Cox) who has been sent to investigate the circumstances surrounding the death, and the actions of the three men implicated in the deaths: members of the undercover anti terrorist squad, the SSU (Special Support Unit). Kerrigan is initially fearless in his investigation, refusing the protection offered to him by the RUC in an effort to remain impartial to people who may be involved. However, when he uncovers a conspiracy to destabilize the previous Labour government, he is faced with the consequences of disclosing the information. Ken Loach based his film on the Stalker affair - the real life case of senior police official John Stalker, assigned to investigate a killing by British security officials. Stalker was removed from the case amidst speculations that the then Thatcher government was unhappy with his findings. Screenplay by Jim Allen.

results.title: Hibiscus town = Furong zhen [Widescreen] [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Shanghai Film Studio and Xie Jin
results.brief_description: A romantic melodrama which follows the fortunes of a bean curd seller, Hu Yuyin, through the political turmoil of the early sixties, the purges at the height of the Cultural Revolution in the mid-sixties and the end of mass persecution and rehabilitation of ‘rightists’ in the late seventies. The film spans the period by honing in on Hu’s life in three years (1963, 1966, 1979). Hu, as a small businesswoman, is the target for the hardline militants but she is a survivor. She forms a relationship with Qui, reviled by the militants. Hu and Qui are branded as a ‘black couple’ and reduced to street sweepers. This is veteran director Xie Jin’s attempt to answer the challenge of the ‘Fifth Generation’ filmmakers by making a film with a critical edge. It was a popular success in China. Cast includes Liu Xiaoquing, Jiang Wen and Zheng Zaishi. In Mandarin with English subtitles.

results.title: Hi 5: star dreaming
results.creator_credit: Kids Like Us, Nine Films and Television, Posie Graeme-Evans and Helena Harris
results.brief_description: Join the Hi5 gang as they take you on an all singing, all dancing, activity filled exploration of the starry sky above. Tim takes his silver spaceship into the stars to see if the stars make music. Kelli and Charli admire the shimmering night sky. Nathan makes a superhero costume, Kathleen makes a collage and Nathan takes a moonwalk. All 5 take a magic carpet ride to Cloudland. Suitable for lower primary school children. Created by Helena Harris and Posie Graham-Evans.

results.title: Hi 5: It's a Hi 5 Christmas
results.creator_credit: Alisa Smeaton, Kids Like Us, Nine Films and Television, Ian Munro, Russell Burton and Gary Newhnam
results.brief_description: A Hi5 Christmas extravaganza! The usual features of a Hi5 television program with the bonus of a live Christmas concert performed in front of an audience at the Sidney Myer Music Bowl in Melbourne. Can be viewed by pressing Play or by selecting the profiles for each group member: Charli, Nathan, Kathleen, Tim or Kellie. Includes “Body move”, “Shapes in space”, “Puzzles and patterns”, “Making music” and “Word play”. Suitable for very young children or early primary school age. Created by Helena Harris and Posie Graeme-Evans.

results.title: HHH: portrait of Hou Hsiao-Hsien [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Xavier Carniaux, AMIP, La Sept-Arte, INA France, Arc Light Films and Olivier Assayas
results.brief_description: Documentary on acclaimed filmmaker Hou Hsiao-Hsien, considered by many to be the greatest Taiwanese filmmaker of all time. Directed by his friend and colleague Olivier Assayas, the film is an exuberant profile of a director known for his quietly restrained, elliptical films. Examining the questions of identity and “native land,” Hou returns to the setting of his youth to talk to childhood friends and discuss his films. His body of work is inseparably linked with the recent history of Taiwan and must be located within the context of an intellectual Nouvelle Vague that united Taiwanese writers, journalists and filmmakers at the end of the 1970s, when the end of censorship enabled free discussions, through film and literature, about Taiwan’s society. As Hou escorts Assayas around his childhood haunts of Taipei and its environs, he reveals himself to be charmingly wry, politically and critically engaged—and surprisingly fond of karaoke. A number of Hou Hsiao-Hsien’s films are available in the Lending Collection on VHS. In French, English, Mandarin and Taiwanese with English subtitles.

results.title: Heysen on Heysen
results.creator_credit: Lesley Hammond, Milton Ingerson Film and Television Productions, South Australian Film Corporation and John Dick
results.brief_description: A filmic retrospective of a selection of paintings of Sir Hans Heysen, many from private collections, that reveal Heysen the man. Very lyrical, both visually and vocally.

results.title: Hey, Kelly!
results.creator_credit: Sook-Yin Lee, Wolf Koenig, Penny Ritco and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Playing Fair”.
During a friendly game of tag, Robert calls Kelly a racist name and a fight ensues. Both Kelly and Robert are given detention, and the Principal gives them a task where they must co-operate in order to achieve the desired end. It is through this co-operation and working together, that Robert realises that he has a great deal in common with Kelly, and that her “difference” is only “skin-deep”.
